scenarios.name: Successful Login and Creation of a Core Task
scenarios.description: This scenario verifies a user can successfully log in, select a company, navigate to the Tasks page, and create a basic task with only the required fields (Task Name and Due Date).
user_journey: Navigate to the application base URL and wait for the login page to load.
Enter a valid email address from the test data.
Click the 'Continue' button.
Enter the corresponding valid password.
Click the 'Login' button.
Wait for the company selection page and click on the correct company name.
After the dashboard opens, click on the 'Action Items' menu item.
Click on the 'Tasks' submenu option and wait for the Manage Tasks page to load.
Click the 'New Task' button to open the task creation form.
Enter a valid 'Short Task Name' from the test data.
Click the date picker input field and enter a valid 'Due_Date' in MM/DD/YYYY format, then press ENTER.
Scroll to the bottom of the form and click the 'Save' button.
Wait for the Manage Tasks page to reload.
acceptance_criteria: User is successfully authenticated and navigates to the Manage Tasks page.
The 'New Task' form opens successfully.
Task Name and Due Date are entered and accepted by the system.
The task is created successfully upon clicking 'Save'.
The user is returned to the Manage Tasks page, confirmed by the visibility of the 'New Task' button.
test_data_requirements: A valid user Email and Password.
A valid Company_Name associated with the user.
A valid Due_Date in MM/DD/YYYY format (e.g., 11/30/2025).

scenarios.name: Create Task with Individual Team Member Assignment
scenarios.description: This scenario verifies that a task can be created and successfully assigned to one or more specific, existing users by searching for their email addresses.
user_journey: Assuming the user is already logged in and on the Manage Tasks page, click the 'New Task' button.
Enter a valid 'Short Task Name' and 'Due_Date'.
Scroll down to the assignment section.

For each email address in the 'Assigned_To' field: click the 'Search or Invite Team Members' input field, enter the user email, wait for the autocomplete dropdown, and click the matching user option to select them.
Scroll to the bottom of the form and click the 'Save' button.
acceptance_criteria: The specified user emails are entered into the assignment field.
The autocomplete dropdown appears with matching, existing users.
The selected users are successfully added to the task assignment.
The task is created successfully and the user is returned to the Manage Tasks page.
test_data_requirements: A unique Task_Name and a valid Due_Date.
The 'Assigned_To' field must contain one or more comma-separated email addresses of users that exist in the system (e.g., 'user1@example.com, user2@example.com').

scenarios.name: Create Task with Bulk Assignment ('Assign to all Users') and Priority Alignment
scenarios.description: This scenario verifies the creation of a task using the 'Assign to all Users' bulk assignment option and aligning it with a pre-existing Priority.
user_journey: Assuming the user is on the Manage Tasks page, click the 'New Task' button.
Enter a valid 'Short Task Name' and 'Due_Date'.
Locate the 'Assign to all Users' checkbox and click it.
Scroll to the Priority alignment section and click the 'Start typing to search Priorities' input field.
Enter the name of an existing priority from the test data.
Wait for the dropdown to populate and click the matching priority option to select it.
Scroll to the bottom of the form and click the 'Save' button.
acceptance_criteria: The 'Assign to all Users' checkbox is successfully selected.
The specified Priority is found and selected from the dropdown.
The task is created successfully with the correct bulk assignment and priority alignment.
The user is returned to the Manage Tasks page.
test_data_requirements: A unique Task_Name and a valid Due_Date.
The 'Assigned_To' field must be 'Assign to all Users'.
The 'Align_Priority' field must contain the name of a Priority that already exists in the test environment.

scenarios.name: Create Task with Huddle Alignment and File Document Upload
scenarios.description: This scenario verifies that a task can be created with an alignment to a pre-existing Huddle and a successful file attachment.
user_journey: Assuming the user is on the Manage Tasks page, click the 'New Task' button.
Enter a valid 'Short Task Name' and 'Due_Date'.
Scroll to the Huddle alignment section and click the 'Start typing to search Huddles' input field.
Enter the name of an existing huddle from the test data.
Wait for the dropdown to populate and click the matching huddle option to select it.
Scroll to the Documents section and click the '+' icon.
In the document dialog, enter the 'Document_Name' and 'Document_Description'.
Ensure the document type is 'File'.
Locate the hidden file input, make it visible, and send the full file path to it.
Wait for the file to upload and click the 'Save' button in the document dialog.
Click the main 'Save' button to create the task.
acceptance_criteria: The specified Huddle is found and selected from the dropdown.
The document upload dialog opens successfully.
The file specified by the file path is successfully uploaded and attached.
The task is created with the correct Huddle alignment and document attachment.
The user is returned to the Manage Tasks page.
test_data_requirements: A unique Task_Name and a valid Due_Date.
The 'Align_Huddle' field must contain the name of a Huddle that already exists in the test environment.
Document_Name, Document_Description, Document_Type='File', and a Document_File name.
The specified file must exist at the configured 'File_Upload_Base_Path'.

scenarios.name: Create Task with Link Document Attachment
scenarios.description: This scenario verifies that a task can be created with a document of type 'Link' by providing a valid URL.
user_journey: Assuming the user is on the Manage Tasks page, click the 'New Task' button.
Enter a valid 'Short Task Name' and 'Due_Date'.
Scroll to the Documents section and click the '+' icon.
In the document dialog, enter the 'Document_Name'.
Click the document type dropdown and select the 'Link' option.
Enter a valid URL in the 'Enter Link...' field.
Click the 'Save' button in the document dialog.
Click the main 'Save' button to create the task.
acceptance_criteria: The document upload dialog opens successfully.
The document type is successfully changed to 'Link'.
The provided URL is accepted and the document is saved.
The task is created with the link successfully attached.
The user is returned to the Manage Tasks page.
test_data_requirements: A unique Task_Name and a valid Due_Date.

scenarios.name: Data-Driven Creation of Multiple Tasks in a Single Session
scenarios.description: This scenario verifies the system's ability to process multiple task creation requests from an external data source (Excel) sequentially within a single user login session.
user_journey: Execute the login and navigation steps for the first task in the data source.
Successfully create the first task based on its data row.
Verify the system is on the Manage Tasks page.
For the second task in the data source, skip login and click the 'New Task' button directly.
Successfully create the second task based on its data row.
Repeat the process for all subsequent tasks in the data source.
After the last task is created, close the browser.
acceptance_criteria: The user logs in only once at the beginning of the test.
Each task from the external data source is created successfully in sequence.
The user session remains active throughout the entire process.
The system correctly returns to the Manage Tasks page after each task creation, ready for the next one.
test_data_requirements: An external data file (e.g., Excel) with at least two rows of complete and valid test data, each representing a unique task to be created.
The first row requires valid login credentials; subsequent rows do not.

dependencies: The test environment must have pre-existing and specific users, Priorities, and Huddles for assignment and alignment to succeed.
A stable network connection is required for the application to respond within the defined wait times.
Valid user credentials must be provided in the test data source.
For file upload scenarios, the specified file (e.g., 'report.pdf') must exist at the hardcoded 'File_Upload_Base_Path' on the test execution machine.
edge_cases: Creating a task with the due date set to the current day.
Creating a task where the assigned user is the same as the user creating the task.
Uploading a file with a name containing special characters or spaces (that are valid).
Creating multiple tasks back-to-back as quickly as the UI allows to test session stability.
